trans-unit.source: IPython Notebook | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: IPython Notebook | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: A tutorial that shows how to deploy the IPython Notebook on Azure, using Linux or Windows virtual machines (VMs).
trans-unit.target: A tutorial that shows how to deploy the IPython Notebook on Azure, using Linux or Windows virtual machines (VMs).

trans-unit.source: The <linkText>IPython project</linkText><title></title> provides a collection of tools for scientific computing that include powerful interactive shells, high-performance and easy to use parallel libraries and a web-based environment called the IPython Notebook.
trans-unit.target: The <linkText>IPython project</linkText><title></title> provides a collection of tools for scientific computing that include powerful interactive shells, high-performance and easy to use parallel libraries and a web-based environment called the IPython Notebook.

trans-unit.source: The Notebook provides a working environment for interactive computing that combines code execution with the creation of a live computational document.
trans-unit.target: The Notebook provides a working environment for interactive computing that combines code execution with the creation of a live computational document.

trans-unit.source: These notebook files can contain arbitrary text, mathematical formulas, input code, results, graphics, videos and any other kind of media that a modern web browser is capable of displaying.
trans-unit.target: These notebook files can contain arbitrary text, mathematical formulas, input code, results, graphics, videos and any other kind of media that a modern web browser is capable of displaying.

trans-unit.source: Whether you're absolutely new to Python and want to learn it in a fun, interactive environment or do some serious parallel/technical computing, the IPython Notebook is a great choice.
trans-unit.target: Whether you're absolutely new to Python and want to learn it in a fun, interactive environment or do some serious parallel/technical computing, the IPython Notebook is a great choice.

trans-unit.source: As an illustration of its capabilities, the following screenshot shows the IPython Notebook being used, in combination with the SciPy and Matplotlib packages, to analyze the structure of a sound recording.
trans-unit.target: As an illustration of its capabilities, the following screenshot shows the IPython Notebook being used, in combination with the SciPy and Matplotlib packages, to analyze the structure of a sound recording.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This article will show you how to deploy the IPython Notebook on Microsoft Azure, using Linux or Windows virtual machines (VMs).
trans-unit.target: This article will show you how to deploy the IPython Notebook on Microsoft Azure, using Linux or Windows virtual machines (VMs).

trans-unit.source: By using the IPython Notebook on Azure, you can easily provide a web-accessible interface to scalable computational resources with all the power of Python and its many libraries.
trans-unit.target: By using the IPython Notebook on Azure, you can easily provide a web-accessible interface to scalable computational resources with all the power of Python and its many libraries.

trans-unit.source: Since all installation is done in the cloud, users can access these resources without the need for any local configuration beyond a modern web browser.
trans-unit.target: Since all installation is done in the cloud, users can access these resources without the need for any local configuration beyond a modern web browser.

trans-unit.source: The first step is to create a virtual machine (VM) running on Azure.
trans-unit.target: The first step is to create a virtual machine (VM) running on Azure.

trans-unit.source: This VM is a complete operating system in the cloud and will be used to run the IPython Notebook.
trans-unit.target: This VM is a complete operating system in the cloud and will be used to run the IPython Notebook.

trans-unit.source: Azure is capable of running both Linux and Windows virtual machines, and we will cover the setup of IPython on both types of virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Azure is capable of running both Linux and Windows virtual machines, and we will cover the setup of IPython on both types of virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions given here[portal-vm-linux] to create a virtual machine of the OpenSUSE or Ubuntu distribution.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions given here[portal-vm-linux] to create a virtual machine of the OpenSUSE or Ubuntu distribution.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses OpenSUSE 13.2 and Ubuntu Server 14.04 LTS.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses OpenSUSE 13.2 and Ubuntu Server 14.04 LTS.

trans-unit.source: We'll assume the default user name azureuser.
trans-unit.target: We'll assume the default user name azureuser.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions given here[portal-vm-windows] to create a virtual machine of the Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter distribution.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions given here[portal-vm-windows] to create a virtual machine of the Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter distribution.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, we'll assume that the user name is azureuser.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, we'll assume that the user name is azureuser.

trans-unit.source: This step applies to both the Linux and Windows VM.
trans-unit.target: This step applies to both the Linux and Windows VM.

trans-unit.source: Later on we will configure IPython to run its notebook server on port 9999.
trans-unit.target: Later on we will configure IPython to run its notebook server on port 9999.

trans-unit.source: To make this port publicly available, we must create an endpoint in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: To make this port publicly available, we must create an endpoint in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: This endpoint opens up a port in the Azure firewall and maps the public port (HTTPS, 443) to the private port on the VM (9999).
trans-unit.target: This endpoint opens up a port in the Azure firewall and maps the public port (HTTPS, 443) to the private port on the VM (9999).

trans-unit.source: To create an endpoint, go to the VM dashboard, click Endpoints, then click Add Endpoint and create a new endpoint (called ipython_nb in this example).
trans-unit.target: To create an endpoint, go to the VM dashboard, click Endpoints, then click Add Endpoint and create a new endpoint (called ipython_nb in this example).

trans-unit.source: Pick TCP for the protocol, 443 for the public port and 9999 for the private port.
trans-unit.target: Pick TCP for the protocol, 443 for the public port and 9999 for the private port.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After this step, the Endpoints Dashboard tab will look like the next screenshot.
trans-unit.target: After this step, the Endpoints Dashboard tab will look like the next screenshot.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To run the IPython Notebook on our VM, we must first install IPython and its dependencies.
trans-unit.target: To run the IPython Notebook on our VM, we must first install IPython and its dependencies.

trans-unit.source: To install IPython and its dependencies, SSH into the Linux VM, complete the following steps.
trans-unit.target: To install IPython and its dependencies, SSH into the Linux VM, complete the following steps.

trans-unit.source: Install <linkText>NumPy[numpy]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Matplotlib[matplotlib]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Tornado[tornado]</linkText><title></title> and other IPython's dependencies with the following commands.
trans-unit.target: Install <linkText>NumPy[numpy]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Matplotlib[matplotlib]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Tornado[tornado]</linkText><title></title> and other IPython's dependencies with the following commands.

trans-unit.source: To install IPython and its dependencies, SSH into the Linux VM and carry out the following steps.
trans-unit.target: To install IPython and its dependencies, SSH into the Linux VM and carry out the following steps.

trans-unit.source: First, retrieve new lists of packages with the following command.
trans-unit.target: First, retrieve new lists of packages with the following command.

trans-unit.source: Install <linkText>NumPy[numpy]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Matplotlib[matplotlib]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Tornado[tornado]</linkText><title></title> and other IPython's dependencies with the following commands.
trans-unit.target: Install <linkText>NumPy[numpy]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Matplotlib[matplotlib]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Tornado[tornado]</linkText><title></title> and other IPython's dependencies with the following commands.

trans-unit.source: To install IPython and its dependencies on the Windows VM, use Remote Desktop to connect to the VM.
trans-unit.target: To install IPython and its dependencies on the Windows VM, use Remote Desktop to connect to the VM.

trans-unit.source: Then carry out the following steps, using the Windows PowerShell to run all command-line actions.
trans-unit.target: Then carry out the following steps, using the Windows PowerShell to run all command-line actions.

trans-unit.source: Note: To download anything using Internet Explorer, you'll need to change some security settings.
trans-unit.target: Note: To download anything using Internet Explorer, you'll need to change some security settings.

trans-unit.source: From Server Manager, click Local Server, then on IE Enhanced Security Configuration, turn it off for administrators.
trans-unit.target: From Server Manager, click Local Server, then on IE Enhanced Security Configuration, turn it off for administrators.

trans-unit.source: You can enable it again after you install IPython.
trans-unit.target: You can enable it again after you install IPython.

trans-unit.source: Download and install the latest 32-bit version of <linkText>Python 2.7</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Download and install the latest 32-bit version of <linkText>Python 2.7</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You will need to add C:\Python27 and C:\Python27\Scripts to your PATH environment variable.
trans-unit.target: You will need to add C:\Python27 and C:\Python27\Scripts to your PATH environment variable.

trans-unit.source: Install <linkText>Tornado[tornado]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>PyZMQ[pyzmq]</linkText><title></title> and other IPython's dependencies with the following commands.
trans-unit.target: Install <linkText>Tornado[tornado]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>PyZMQ[pyzmq]</linkText><title></title> and other IPython's dependencies with the following commands.

trans-unit.source: Download and install NumPy[numpy] using the .exe binary installer available on their website.
trans-unit.target: Download and install NumPy[numpy] using the .exe binary installer available on their website.

trans-unit.source: As of this writing, the latest version is numpy-1.9.1-win32-superpack-python2.7.exe.
trans-unit.target: As of this writing, the latest version is numpy-1.9.1-win32-superpack-python2.7.exe.

trans-unit.source: Install <linkText>Matplotlib[matplotlib]</linkText><title></title> with the following command.
trans-unit.target: Install <linkText>Matplotlib[matplotlib]</linkText><title></title> with the following command.

trans-unit.source: Download and install <linkText>OpenSSL</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Download and install <linkText>OpenSSL</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You'll find the required Visual C++ 2008 Redistributable on the same download page.
trans-unit.target: You'll find the required Visual C++ 2008 Redistributable on the same download page.

trans-unit.source: You will need to add C:\OpenSSL-Win32\bin to your PATH environment variable.
trans-unit.target: You will need to add C:\OpenSSL-Win32\bin to your PATH environment variable.

trans-unit.source: When installing OpenSSL, use version 1.0.1g or later as these include a fix for the Heartbleed security vulnerability.
trans-unit.target: When installing OpenSSL, use version 1.0.1g or later as these include a fix for the Heartbleed security vulnerability.

trans-unit.source: Install IPython using the following command.
trans-unit.target: Install IPython using the following command.

trans-unit.source: Open a port in Windows Firewall.
trans-unit.target: Open a port in Windows Firewall.

trans-unit.source: On Windows Server 2012, the firewall will block incoming connections by default.
trans-unit.target: On Windows Server 2012, the firewall will block incoming connections by default.

trans-unit.source: To open port 9999, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To open port 9999, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Start Windows Firewall with Advanced Security from the Start screen.
trans-unit.target: Start Windows Firewall with Advanced Security from the Start screen.

trans-unit.source: Click Inbound Rules in the left panel.
trans-unit.target: Click Inbound Rules in the left panel.

trans-unit.source: Click New Rule in the Actions panel.
trans-unit.target: Click New Rule in the Actions panel.

trans-unit.source: In the New Inbound Rule Wizard, select Port.
trans-unit.target: In the New Inbound Rule Wizard, select Port.

trans-unit.source: In the next screen, select TCP and enter 9999 in Specific local ports.
trans-unit.target: In the next screen, select TCP and enter 9999 in Specific local ports.

trans-unit.source: Accept defaults, give the rule a name and then click Finish.
trans-unit.target: Accept defaults, give the rule a name and then click Finish.

trans-unit.source: Next, we configure the IPython Notebook.
trans-unit.target: Next, we configure the IPython Notebook.

trans-unit.source: The first step is to create a custom IPython configuration profile to encapsulate the configuration information with the following command.
trans-unit.target: The first step is to create a custom IPython configuration profile to encapsulate the configuration information with the following command.

trans-unit.source: Next we cd to the profile directory to create our SSL certificate and edit the profiles configuration file.
trans-unit.target: Next we cd to the profile directory to create our SSL certificate and edit the profiles configuration file.

trans-unit.source: On Linux use the following command.
trans-unit.target: On Linux use the following command.

trans-unit.source: On Windows use the following command.
trans-unit.target: On Windows use the following command.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create the SSL certificate(Linux and Windows).
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create the SSL certificate(Linux and Windows).

trans-unit.source: Note that since we are creating a self-signed SSL certificate, when connecting to the notebook your browser will give you a security warning.
trans-unit.target: Note that since we are creating a self-signed SSL certificate, when connecting to the notebook your browser will give you a security warning.

trans-unit.source: For long-term production use, you will want to use a properly signed certificate associated with your organization.
trans-unit.target: For long-term production use, you will want to use a properly signed certificate associated with your organization.

trans-unit.source: Since certificate management is beyond the scope of this demo, we will stick to a self-signed certificate for now.
trans-unit.target: Since certificate management is beyond the scope of this demo, we will stick to a self-signed certificate for now.

trans-unit.source: In addition to using a certificate, you must also provide a password to protect your notebook from unauthorized use.
trans-unit.target: In addition to using a certificate, you must also provide a password to protect your notebook from unauthorized use.

trans-unit.source: For security reasons IPython uses encrypted passwords in its configuration file, so you'll need to encrypt your password first.
trans-unit.target: For security reasons IPython uses encrypted passwords in its configuration file, so you'll need to encrypt your password first.

trans-unit.source: IPython provides a utility to do so; at a command prompt run the following command.
trans-unit.target: IPython provides a utility to do so; at a command prompt run the following command.

trans-unit.source: This will prompt you for a password and confirmation, and will then print the password as follows.
trans-unit.target: This will prompt you for a password and confirmation, and will then print the password as follows.

trans-unit.source: Next, we will edit the profile's configuration file, which is the ipython_notebook_config.py file in the profile directory you are in.
trans-unit.target: Next, we will edit the profile's configuration file, which is the ipython_notebook_config.py file in the profile directory you are in.

trans-unit.source: Note that this file may not exist -- just create it.
trans-unit.target: Note that this file may not exist -- just create it.

trans-unit.source: This file has a number of fields and by default all are commented out.
trans-unit.target: This file has a number of fields and by default all are commented out.

trans-unit.source: You can open this file with any text editor of your liking, and you should ensure that it has at least the following content.
trans-unit.target: You can open this file with any text editor of your liking, and you should ensure that it has at least the following content.

trans-unit.source: At this point we are ready to start the IPython Notebook.
trans-unit.target: At this point we are ready to start the IPython Notebook.

trans-unit.source: To do this, navigate to the directory you want to store notebooks in and start the IPython Notebook server with the following command.
trans-unit.target: To do this, navigate to the directory you want to store notebooks in and start the IPython Notebook server with the following command.

trans-unit.source: You should now be able to access your IPython Notebook at the address https://[Your Chosen Name Here].cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: You should now be able to access your IPython Notebook at the address https://[Your Chosen Name Here].cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: When you first access your notebook, the login page asks for your password.
trans-unit.target: When you first access your notebook, the login page asks for your password.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: And once you log in, you will see the "IPython Notebook Dashboard", which is the control center for all notebook operations.
trans-unit.target: And once you log in, you will see the "IPython Notebook Dashboard", which is the control center for all notebook operations.

trans-unit.source: From this page you can create new notebooks and open existing ones.
trans-unit.target: From this page you can create new notebooks and open existing ones.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you click the New Notebook button, you will see the following opening page.
trans-unit.target: If you click the New Notebook button, you will see the following opening page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The area marked with an In []: prompt is the input area, and here you can type any valid Python code and it will execute when you hit Shift-Enter or click on the "Play" icon (the right-pointing triangle in the toolbar).
trans-unit.target: The area marked with an In []: prompt is the input area, and here you can type any valid Python code and it will execute when you hit Shift-Enter or click on the "Play" icon (the right-pointing triangle in the toolbar).

trans-unit.source: Since we have configured the notebook to start with NumPy and Matplotlib support automatically, you can even produce figures as shown in the next screenshot.
trans-unit.target: Since we have configured the notebook to start with NumPy and Matplotlib support automatically, you can even produce figures as shown in the next screenshot.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The notebook itself should feel very natural to anyone who has used Python and a word processor, because it is in some ways a mix of both: you can execute blocks of Python code, but you can also keep notes and other text by changing the style of a cell from "Code" to "Markdown" using the drop-down menu in the toolbar.
trans-unit.target: The notebook itself should feel very natural to anyone who has used Python and a word processor, because it is in some ways a mix of both: you can execute blocks of Python code, but you can also keep notes and other text by changing the style of a cell from "Code" to "Markdown" using the drop-down menu in the toolbar.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: But this is much more than a word processor, as the IPython notebook allows the mixing of computation and rich media (text, graphics, video and virtually anything a modern web browser can display).
trans-unit.target: But this is much more than a word processor, as the IPython notebook allows the mixing of computation and rich media (text, graphics, video and virtually anything a modern web browser can display).

trans-unit.source: For example, you can mix explanatory videos with computation for educational purposes.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can mix explanatory videos with computation for educational purposes.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: or, as shown in the next screenshot, embed external websites that remain live and usable, inside of a notebook file.
trans-unit.target: or, as shown in the next screenshot, embed external websites that remain live and usable, inside of a notebook file.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: And with the power of Python's many excellent libraries for scientific and technical computing, in the following screenshot, a simple calculation can be performed with the same ease as a complex network analysis, all in one environment.
trans-unit.target: And with the power of Python's many excellent libraries for scientific and technical computing, in the following screenshot, a simple calculation can be performed with the same ease as a complex network analysis, all in one environment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This paradigm of mixing the power of the modern web with live computation offers many possibilities, and is ideally suited for the cloud; the Notebook can be used:
trans-unit.target: This paradigm of mixing the power of the modern web with live computation offers many possibilities, and is ideally suited for the cloud; the Notebook can be used:

trans-unit.source: As a computational scratchpad to record exploratory work on a problem.
trans-unit.target: As a computational scratchpad to record exploratory work on a problem.

trans-unit.source: To share results with colleagues, either in 'live' computational form or in hardcopy formats (HTML, PDF).
trans-unit.target: To share results with colleagues, either in 'live' computational form or in hardcopy formats (HTML, PDF).

trans-unit.source: To distribute and present live teaching materials that involve computation, so students can immediately experiment with the real code, modify it and re-execute it interactively.
trans-unit.target: To distribute and present live teaching materials that involve computation, so students can immediately experiment with the real code, modify it and re-execute it interactively.

trans-unit.source: To provide "executable papers" that present the results of research in a way that can be immediately reproduced, validated and extended by others.
trans-unit.target: To provide "executable papers" that present the results of research in a way that can be immediately reproduced, validated and extended by others.

trans-unit.source: As a platform for collaborative computing: multiple users can log in to the same notebook server to share a live computational session.
trans-unit.target: As a platform for collaborative computing: multiple users can log in to the same notebook server to share a live computational session.

trans-unit.source: If you go to the IPython source code <linkText>repository</linkText><title></title>, you will find an entire directory with notebook examples which you can download and then experiment with on your own Azure IPython VM.
trans-unit.target: If you go to the IPython source code <linkText>repository</linkText><title></title>, you will find an entire directory with notebook examples which you can download and then experiment with on your own Azure IPython VM.

trans-unit.source: Simply download the .ipynb files from the site and upload them onto the dashboard of your notebook Azure VM (or download them directly into the VM).
trans-unit.target: Simply download the .ipynb files from the site and upload them onto the dashboard of your notebook Azure VM (or download them directly into the VM).

trans-unit.source: The IPython Notebook provides a powerful interface for accessing interactively the power of the Python ecosystem on Azure.
trans-unit.target: The IPython Notebook provides a powerful interface for accessing interactively the power of the Python ecosystem on Azure.

trans-unit.source: It covers a wide range of usage cases including simple exploration and learning Python, data analysis and visualization, simulation and parallel computing.
trans-unit.target: It covers a wide range of usage cases including simple exploration and learning Python, data analysis and visualization, simulation and parallel computing.

trans-unit.source: The resulting Notebook documents contain a complete record of the computations that are performed and can be shared with other IPython users.
trans-unit.target: The resulting Notebook documents contain a complete record of the computations that are performed and can be shared with other IPython users.

trans-unit.source: The IPython Notebook can be used as a local application, but it is ideally suited for cloud deployments on Azure
trans-unit.target: The IPython Notebook can be used as a local application, but it is ideally suited for cloud deployments on Azure

trans-unit.source: The core features of IPython are also available inside Visual Studio via the <linkText>Python Tools for Visual Studio</linkText><title></title> (PTVS).
trans-unit.target: The core features of IPython are also available inside Visual Studio via the <linkText>Python Tools for Visual Studio</linkText><title></title> (PTVS).

trans-unit.source: PTVS is a free and open-source plug-in from Microsoft that turns Visual Studio into an advanced Python development environment that includes an advanced editor with IntelliSense, debugging, profiling and parallel computing integration.
trans-unit.target: PTVS is a free and open-source plug-in from Microsoft that turns Visual Studio into an advanced Python development environment that includes an advanced editor with IntelliSense, debugging, profiling and parallel computing integration.
